condition.description:
Preterm labor is labor that happens before 37 weeks gestation. Many women have contractions on and off during their third trimester, but true labor refers to contractions that lead to changes in and opening of your cervix.

Some causes of preterm labor include maternal anxiety or depression, fetal stress, infection, and bleeding or distention in the uterus. Preterm labor can, but does not always, lead to preterm birth. About 11 percent of births each year in the U.S. are preterm.

Some symptoms of labor include

  • Cramping
  • Contractions that are mild or come at irregular intervals
  • Aching in your lower back
  • Vaginal discharge with mucus and/or blood

Your doctor can diagnose preterm labor by hearing about your symptoms and doing a physical examination. Doctors manage suspected preterm labor in different ways depending on how much change they see in your cervix, along with any other symptoms or conditions you have. If you're in true labor, doctors can't stop it from happening, but they can give certain medications that will slow it down and other medications that lower your baby's risks if born preterm. If you have a history of preterm birth, your doctor will talk to you about medicines and procedures that can lower the risk of preterm birth in your next pregnancy.
condition.name: Preterm labor
symptoms: Contractions that are mild or come at irregular intervals
Vaginal discharge with mucus and/or blood

carousel_items: The Makena injection is given by your doctor or a helper at home every 7 days in your buttocks.
It’s important that you don’t miss any doses.
Let your doctor know if you notice any unexplained pain while you are on Makena, or if you have a reaction (redness or oozing fluid) at the injection site.

basics.benefits_moa: Makena is an injection that contains hydroxyprogesterone, a progesterone hormone that lowers the risk of having your baby too early (a preterm birth). The exact way Makena works isn't known, but progesterone helps create a healthy environment for your baby in your uterus during the last half of your pregnancy.
basics.bottom_line: Makena lowers your chance of having your baby too early, but you should weigh its risks and benefits carefully with your prenatal care provider.
downsides: Makena injections can cause pain, soreness, swelling, or bruising near the injection site.
Makena isn't right for you if you're pregnant with multiple babies or haven't had a preterm delivery in the past.
In a study, women using Makena had a higher chance of miscarriage, gestational diabetes (diabetes caused by pregnancy), and preeclampsia (high blood pressure and too much protein in your urine).

downsides_processed.orig: Makena injections can cause pain, soreness, swelling, or bruising near the injection site.
Makena isn't right for you if you're pregnant with multiple babies or haven't had a preterm delivery in the past.
In a study, women using Makena had a higher chance of miscarriage, gestational diabetes (diabetes caused by pregnancy), and preeclampsia (high blood pressure and too much protein in your urine).

upsides: Makena helps pregnant women avoid delivering too early if they've already delivered a baby too early in the past.
In studies, Makena increased the amount of time women with a single baby can stay pregnant.

If there's concern that you will have an early delivery (preterm birth), your doctor can start giving you the injection every week in their office. You can start between 16 and 20 weeks and continue through week 37, or until you deliver.

Your doctor can give you this shot every week, or you can get a helper to give it to you at home. There are also programs where pharmacies work with registered nurses to give you this shot in your home. Ask your doctor or pharmacist.

upsides_processed.orig: Makena helps pregnant women avoid delivering too early if they've already delivered a baby too early in the past.
In studies, Makena increased the amount of time women with a single baby can stay pregnant.

If there's concern that you will have an early delivery (preterm birth), your doctor can start giving you the injection every week in their office. You can start between 16 and 20 weeks and continue through week 37, or until you deliver.

Your doctor can give you this shot every week, or you can get a helper to give it to you at home. There are also programs where pharmacies work with registered nurses to give you this shot in your home. Ask your doctor or pharmacist.

drugs.name: Makena

carousel_items_processed.orig: The Makena injection is given by your doctor or a helper at home every 7 days in your buttocks.
It’s important that you don’t miss any doses.
Let your doctor know if you notice any unexplained pain while you are on Makena, or if you have a reaction (redness or oozing fluid) at the injection site.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of blood clots and stroke
risks_warnings.description: Using progestin with or without estrogen can increase your risk of blood clots. Blood clots can cause pain and discomfort from a deep vein thrombosis (a clot in the arm or leg), or serious disability due to a stroke or pulmonary embolism (a clot in the brain or lung). Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.
risk_factors: Personal or family history of blood clots

description_processed.orig: Using progestin with or without estrogen can increase your risk of blood clots. Blood clots can cause pain and discomfort from a deep vein thrombosis (a clot in the arm or leg), or serious disability due to a stroke or pulmonary embolism (a clot in the brain or lung). Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.

risks_warnings.title: Breast cancer
risks_warnings.description: It is not completely clear if progestin, like as Makena, increases your risk of breast cancer. There may be a higher risk if you have a history of breast cancer, so make sure to get routine breast exams.
risk_factors: Personal or family history of breast cancer

description_processed.orig: It is not completely clear if progestin, like as Makena, increases your risk of breast cancer. There may be a higher risk if you have a history of breast cancer, so make sure to get routine breast exams.

risks_warnings.title: Liver problems
risks_warnings.description: Makena is metabolized (broken down) by the liver, so if the liver is damaged, the drug can build up in your body. Stop taking Makena if you notice sudden yellowing of your skin or eyes. Don't start taking it if you have abnormal liver blood tests or a history of liver problems.

description_processed.orig: Makena is metabolized (broken down) by the liver, so if the liver is damaged, the drug can build up in your body. Stop taking Makena if you notice sudden yellowing of your skin or eyes. Don't start taking it if you have abnormal liver blood tests or a history of liver problems.

risks_warnings.title: Health complications from high blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Makena can affect blood glucose (sugar) levels, making it more difficult to control your diabetes if you're taking this medicine. Let your doctor know if you have diabetes before you start taking Makena so you can monitor this closely.

description_processed.orig: Makena can affect blood glucose (sugar) levels, making it more difficult to control your diabetes if you're taking this medicine. Let your doctor know if you have diabetes before you start taking Makena so you can monitor this closely.

risks_warnings.title: Depression
risks_warnings.description: Makena can cause depression. Let your doctor know if you have a history of, or are taking medicines to treat, depression before starting Makena.

description_processed.orig: Makena can cause depression. Let your doctor know if you have a history of, or are taking medicines to treat, depression before starting Makena.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Makena can increase your blood pressure. Check your blood pressure regularly and consider stopping Makena if your blood pressure can't be controlled while on this medicine.

description_processed.orig: Makena can increase your blood pressure. Check your blood pressure regularly and consider stopping Makena if your blood pressure can't be controlled while on this medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Makena contains castor oil and can cause allergic reactions (severe rash, itching, trouble breathing) and angioedema (mouth swelling). Call your doctor and get emergency care immediately if you notice any of these symptoms.

description_processed.orig: Makena contains castor oil and can cause allergic reactions (severe rash, itching, trouble breathing) and angioedema (mouth swelling). Call your doctor and get emergency care immediately if you notice any of these symptoms.

points.name: Oligohydramnios
points.hlt: amniotic fluid and cavity disorders of pregnancy nec

carousel_items: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Indomethacin is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Indomethacin works well for mild to moderate pain and swelling, but it shouldn't be used long-term since it has some serious side effects.
downsides: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious heart and stomach problems. The risk goes up the longer you take it, but problems can happen at any time. Don't take Indomethacin any longer than your doctor recommends.
Indomethacin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when taken with other blood-thinning medicines.
There are similar medicines that you don't have to take as often and can work just as well.
Not a good choice if you have kidney, liver, or stomach problems.

upsides: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective option to relieve mild to moderate pain and swelling.
Treats inflammation problems, such as rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, and acute gout attacks.
In studies, Indomethacin was more effective than Tylenol for treating osteoarthritis pain.
It works as well as Celebrex for treating an acute gout attacks.
Available in capsules, long-acting capsules, suppositories, and as a suspension. All forms, except the suspension, are available as generic medications.

userStories.tip: They aren't judging when they say it can make you suck to your stomach. Spent the night on the bathroom floor a couple hours after taking it.

drugs.name: Indocin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes about 30 minutes to start working and can last about 4 to 6 hours.
Can cause stomach ulcers or bleeding. Don't take it with other blood-thinning medicines without talking to your doctor first.
Can cause headaches. If the headaches continue even after you take a lower dose, talk to your doctor about stopping Indomethacin.
The long-acting capsules must be swallowed whole. Don't crush them.
Take with food or milk to help prevent upset stomach.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. The risk can increase the longer you take it. Talk to your doctor about taking the lowest dose that works for you for the shortest time possible.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can cause serious stomach problems, such as ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. These problems can be life-threatening and can cause death. The risk can increase the longer you take it, but it can happen at any time. Watch out for blood or dark-colored stools. This can be a medical emergency and you should get help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin may cause birth defects. Don't use Indomethacin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Indomethacin can cause serious allergic reactions.  These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. If you have Asthma, don't take Indomethacin if you're experiencing a runny nose (Rhinitis) with or without nasal polyps.  Also, don't take Indomethacin if you've experienced an asthma attack after taking aspirin or other NSAID type medications.  Stop taking Indomethacin and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney or liver function
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose. (No dose adjustments are specified on the manufacturer's label.)

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

description_processed.orig: Indomethacin can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Indomethacin.

risks_warnings.title: Bleeding or bruising
risks_warnings.description: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: You can bleed or bruise more easily while taking Indomethacin. Tell your doctor about any medicines you are taking or any health conditions before starting Indomethacin. If you take blood-thinning medicines, don't take Indomethacin without talking to your doctor first.

carousel_items: The dose of Prometrium will be different depending on what you’re using it for, so take it exactly the way your doctor tells you.
It's important to take it the same time every day.
Prometrium capsules can make you feel tired or dizzy, so take it just before you go to sleep every night.
If you have trouble swallowing the capsule, take it with a full glass of water while standing up.
Can cause cramps, bloating, trouble sleeping, acne, weight gain, facial skin discoloration, or irregular periods.
Tell your doctor about any severe stomach pain or yellowing of your eyes or skin.
Get immediate medical help if you have sudden vision changes or one-sided weakness (signs of stroke) or chest pain and trouble breathing (signs of a pulmonary embolism).

basics.benefits_moa: Prometrium contains progesterone, a hormone that regulates the menstrual cycle and protects the uterus from the negative effects of estrogen when used for postmenopausal treatment.
basics.bottom_line: Prometrium regulates menstrual cycles, treats heavy bleeding, and prevents thickening of the uterus.
downsides: Prometrium capsules contain peanut oil, so you can't take it if you're allergic to peanuts.
Prometrium can cause serious birth defects in babies, so you can't take Prometrium if you’re pregnant or breast-feeding.
Increases your risk of blood clots.

downsides_processed.orig: Prometrium capsules contain peanut oil, so you can't take it if you're allergic to peanuts.
Prometrium can cause serious birth defects in babies, so you can't take Prometrium if you’re pregnant or breast-feeding.
Increases your risk of blood clots.

upsides: Helps to regulate your menstrual cycle.
Lowers the risk of uterine cancer when used with estrogen in women with an intact uterus.
Available as a capsule or an injection, so you can choose what works best for you.

upsides_processed.orig: Helps to regulate your menstrual cycle.
Lowers the risk of uterine cancer when used with estrogen in women with an intact uterus.
Available as a capsule or an injection, so you can choose what works best for you.

drugs.one_liner: Taken for irregular bleeding or paired with estrogen replacements for menopause.

labeled_indications.indication: Prevention of uterine cancer in women taking estrogen

risks_warnings.title: Ovarian cancer
risks_warnings.description: Prometrium contains progestin. It could cause a higher risk of ovarian cancer, especially if you have a family history of it. Your doctor can help you weigh the risks versus the benefits of this medication.

description_processed.orig: Prometrium contains progestin. It could cause a higher risk of ovarian cancer, especially if you have a family history of it. Your doctor can help you weigh the risks versus the benefits of this medication.

Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Prometrium contains peanut oil and can cause allergic reactions (severe rash, itching, trouble breathing) or angioedema (mouth swelling). Call your doctor and get emergency care immediately if you notice any of these symptoms.

description_processed.orig: Prometrium contains peanut oil and can cause allergic reactions (severe rash, itching, trouble breathing) or angioedema (mouth swelling). Call your doctor and get emergency care immediately if you notice any of these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Fluid retention (Foot and leg swelling)
risks_warnings.description: Prometrium can cause extra fluid to build up in your legs, ankles, feet, and sometimes arms and hands. It can be mild to severe and may not go away immediately. Swelling can be worse if you have other medical conditions that increase your risk. If it becomes severe, talk to your doctor since you may need to stop taking Prometrium.
